name: overgraze
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to eat too much grass in an area or to have too many animals eating grass in an area, which damages the environment: The pasture land had little grass on it, indicating that it had been overgrazed. We can keep two ponies in the field, as long as they don't overgraze it. See
overgrazing
More examplesFewer examplesCows will overgraze the area and keep new plants from growing.We move the horses from pasture to pasture so we don't overgraze them. We will no longer let their cattle overgraze our fields.
